alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 4:39AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...An area of heavy Rain showers will impact portions of Alleghany and Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina, Pulaski,Giles, Bland, Carroll, Wythe and Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia and the City of Galax through 530 AM EDT... At 435 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy rain showers extending from Bluefield to Wytheville to Jefferson. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall and localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on roadways and flooding of poor drainage and low-lying areas. Locations impacted include... Radford... Pulaski... Wytheville... Galax... Bland... Bluefield... Pearisburg... and Interstate 81 between mile-markers 35 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
